member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Mgc.Core.CommunicationManager.SendMessage(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sends commmand directly to the device and returns given number of bytes read from device
member.param: Command to be send
Number of bytes to receive from device
member.returns: The demanded number of bytes saved in global _binaryBuffer
member.remarks: Due to performance issues we do not allocate new byte buffer for return values each time the function is called! We use _binaryBuffer here!!! So assert, that e.g.SendMessage(string) function is not called until the binary response of this function is evaluated - since SendMessage(string) also uses _binaryBuffer !!!!

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Mgc.Core.CommunicationManager.GetPossibleDataAcquisitionModes
member.summary: Gets the possible data acquisition modes according to the current synchronization settings of the device. When the device detects a hardware synchronization (typically established via a synchronization cable), the returned list will will contain the mode . If the device uses a time based synchronization (e.g. PTP or NTP), the returned list will contain the mode . Since most devices are able to fulfill an unsynchronized measurement, the returned list will most likely contain the mode . If the device is not connected, the list of possible data acquisition modes will be empty.
member.returns: List of possible for this device according to its current synchronization settings.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Mgc.Core.CommunicationManager.IsSyncSlave
member.summary: Determines whether the current device is synch slave. This means that there is a sync cable connected to the sync in and the device is currently synchronized by a sync master.
member.returns: if device is sync slave, else .

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Mgc.Core.CommunicationManager.ResetDevice(System.Collections.Generic.List{Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Problems.Problem})
member.summary:
Resets the device to its factory default settings. This is done in the same way as CatmanAp does it: - Switch to AB Client process (CIX0) - Stop PC-Card-Recording (STP) - Free link resources (MCS) - Delete parameterset 0 (SCM-1) - Switch back to original process?? (CIX) - loading factory setup for each amplifier (PCSx,SPS0,TDD0)
Further for each slot/subslot: - Reset channel name (UserChannelCommment) for each slot/subchannel to "CH_1_"+Slotnumber+"_"+SubchannelNumber) - Suppress cyclical autocalibration (*CAN1) - Write "" into RAM of the amplifier. The status is set to "Ident user") (*TID0) - Set signal Filter to Bessel,5Hz (*SFC142,935)
member.param: Warnings and errors that occurred during resetting the device

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Mgc.Core.CommunicationManager.SetDeviceName(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Problems.Problem})
member.summary: Sets the name of the device.
member.param: Name of the device.
The problems during assign.

member.summary: Reads all measurement values of analog in, virtual and can in signals and saves them into the according signal of the given signalList. Other signal types (e.g. digital signals) will not be updated!

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Mgc.Core.CommunicationManager.AssignMeasurementGroups(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Collections.Generic.List{Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.Signal}})
member.summary:
Assigns a measurement group for each signal of the signalLists Each of the signalList in signalLists contains signals that have the same SampleRate...
Time channels of the measurement groups are set to NTP (2*32Bit integer, 4byte 2-32 parts of a second, 4byte seconds since 1.1.1970!
member.param: Up to 3 signal lists are supported by MGC

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Mgc.Core.CommunicationManager.AssignRecordingMasksAndSignalType(System.Collections.Generic.List{Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.Signal},System.Int32)
member.summary:
Assigns recording mask for data acquisition... Recording mask is build for each slot seperately and looks similiar to: E.g.: Let following List of Slots and Positions {Slot,Position} be the sorted List of signals to measure: List= {1,1},{1,2},{1,3},{2,2},{2,4} This list has to generate following sequence to parameterize the DMP: PCS1; SMS1,2,3 //select slot1 and set recording mask to subchannels 1,2 and 3 PCS2; SMS2,4 //select slot2 and set recording mask to subchannels 2 and 4 ...
MCS1,2,17,18 //use slot 1 and 2 (and timechannels1 (17) and timechannel2 (18) for measurement
NumberOfDifferentSampleRates is used to activate the various timechannels...
member.param: a sorted list of signals (slot/position ascending order)
is needed to setup slots for time channels

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Mgc.Core.CommunicationManager.UnifySensorSettingsOfDependentChannels(Hbm.Api.Mgc.Connectors.MgcAnalogInConnector)
member.summary: Unifies bridge sensor settings by changing sensor settings of dependent channels and raising SensorChanged events for the changes channels. ML801/AP810: Sets the same excitation voltage for all channels of the slot to which the given MgcAnalogInConnector is connected. All channels connected to the same slot do support only ONE common excitation voltage for bridges! ML801/AP814 and AP815: Sets the same sensor settings for all channels of the slot to which the given MgcAnalogInConnector is connected by keeping the scalings of the dependent channels untouched. All channels connected to the same slot do support only ONE common sensor setting for bridges!
member.param: Connector on which the excitation voltage has been changed

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Mgc.Core.CommunicationManager.BridgeSensorsPropertiesDiffer(Hbm.Api.SensorDB.Entities.Sensors.BridgeSensor,Hbm.Api.SensorDB.Entities.Sensors.BridgeSensor)
member.summary: Checks if the properties of the given bridge sensors differ.
member.param: The bridge sensor1.
The bridge sensor2.
member.returns: True if relavant properties of given bridge sensors differ, else false

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Mgc.Core.CommunicationManager.UnifyFiltersOfDependentChannels(Hbm.Api.Mgc.Connectors.MgcAnalogInConnector)
member.summary: Sets the same filter frequency and type for all signals of the slot to which the given MgcAnalogInConnector is connected. All signals connected to the same slot do support only ONE common filter type and frequency! Filters of dependent channels will be checked and a FiltersChanged event is generated if there are differences to the filter of the given connector.
member.param: Connector on which the filter of the signal has been changed

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Mgc.Core.CommunicationManager.UnifySampleRatesOfDependentSignals(Hbm.Api.Mgc.Signals.MgcDigitalSignal)
member.summary: Sets the same SampleRate for all signals of the slot and position to which the given MgcDigitalSignal is connected. All signals connected to the same slot and position do support only ONE common SampleRate! The sample rate is only present in our object model. We can not assign sample rates to certain signals of the device! MGC organizes the sample rate in sample rate groups, which are build during Device.PrepareDaq.
member.param: Connector on which the filter of the signal has been changed
Problems according to adapted settings.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Mgc.Core.CommunicationManager.UnifyAutoCalibrationModeOfDependentChannels(Hbm.Api.Mgc.Channels.MgcAnalogInChannel)
member.summary: Sets the same AutoCalibraionMode for all channels of the slot to which the given MgcAnalogInChannel is connected. All channels connected to the same slot do support only ONE common AutoCalibrationMode!
member.param: Channel on which the AutoCalibrationMode has been changed

member.name: T:Hbm.Api.Mgc.MgcLimitSwitch
member.summary: Class that describes a limit switch

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Mgc.MgcLimitSwitch.LimitSwitchNumber
member.summary: Number of the limit switch. PMX supports 32 limit switches (1..32)

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Mgc.MgcLimitSwitch.Enabled
member.summary: True, if limit switch operation is activated. False, if limit switch if off.

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Mgc.MgcLimitSwitch.InputSignal
member.summary: Signal whose measurement value is used to evaluate the limit switch

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Mgc.MgcLimitSwitch.OperatingDirection
member.summary: Operation direction of the limit switch.

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Mgc.MgcLimitSwitch.Limit
member.summary: Limit (dependent on OperationDirection this may also be used to define the lower band value)

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Mgc.MgcLimitSwitch.Hysteresis
member.summary: Hysteresis (dependent on OperationDirection this may also be used to define the band span)

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Mgc.MgcLimitSwitch.ResetBehaviorMask
member.summary: Reset behavior (can be used for hysteresis management). Binary mask which is ANDed with all digital inputs. If the result is >0 (true) this limit switch is cleared. Value range: 0,1,2,4,8,16,...32768 corresponding to the 16 digital inputs of the PMX. The reset behavior can be inverted with InvertResetBehavior. Default setting is 0.

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Mgc.MgcLimitSwitch.InvertResetBehaviour
member.summary: If true, the defined ResetBehavior is inverted.

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Mgc.MgcLimitSwitch.IgnoreMeasurementValueStatus
member.summary: If true: The status of the measurement value is ignored during evaluation of limit switch status. If false: Limit switch is only evaluated, if measurement value status is OK. Otherwise limit switch status will be frozen.

Port for connecting the device

member.summary: Name of the family to which this device belongs
member.remarks: This MUST be exactly the same string as in property FamilyName in class

member.summary: Network adapter of the device. Only for internal use

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Mgc.MgcDevice.SignalLists
member.summary: Returns a list of signal lists, each containing signals with the same sample rate. MGC allows a maximum of 3 different sample rates that may be used at once.

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Mgc.MgcDevice.AdditionalFeatures
member.summary: Additional features of the MGC device.
member.remarks: Additional features cover all public functions that are not predetermined by the abstract functions of the Device class. E.g.: function of MgcDevice belongs to these additional features of MgcDevice, whereas does NOT belong to additional features, since it is an abstract function of the Device class.

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Mgc.MgcDevice.MeasurementSignalType
member.summary: Type of the measuring signal to use for data acquisition. This is valid for all measurement tasks. Changing this property during a running measurement has no effect on the acquired measurement values. Please change this property BEFORE you prepare and start your measurement. Default is . There is no difference in the measurement values between both signal types because the tare of the MGC, which would make the difference, is always set to 0.0 when connecting the device. This function is actually only used to prevent link resource conflicts in certain cases (e.g. ML77 requests gross signal in parallel).

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Mgc.MgcDevice.AssignConnector(Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Connectors.Connector,System.Collections.Generic.List{Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Problems.Problem}@)
member.summary: Assigns the settings of the given connector (including channels, sensor, signals etc.) to the physical connector of the device. The warnings and errors during the assignment process are collected in the list of problems.
member.param: The actual (modified) connector.
The warnings and errors that occurred during the assignment process.
member.exception: Thrown if the does not belong to this device.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Mgc.MgcDevice.Reset(System.Collections.Generic.List{Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Problems.Problem}@)
member.summary: Resets the device to its factory default settings. Caution! After this function has been called, the device will be disconnected. This is necessary because the parameterization of the device changes by loading the factory defaults and the device therefore will be no longer consistent with the associated object model of the device. (When implementing this function, be sure to disconnect the device and to call to signal that the device has been disconnected.)
member.param: Warnings and errors that occurred during resetting the device
member.returns: true if no error has occurred, otherwise false
member.remarks: Notice that the device may be unreachable for a certain time and the device is disconnected after the execution of this function.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Mgc.MgcDevice.GetPossibleDataAcquisitionModes
member.summary: Gets the possible data acquisition modes according to the current synchronization settings of the device. When the device detects a hardware synchronization (typically established via a synchronization cable), the returned list will contain the mode . If the device uses a time based synchronization (e.g. PTP or NTP), the returned list will contain the mode . Since most devices are able to fulfill an unsynchronized measurement, the returned list will most likely contain the mode . If the device is not connected, the list of possible data acquisition modes will be empty.
member.returns: List of possible for this device according to its current synchronization settings.

Example: Given ConnectionInfo is EthernetConnectionInfo but the device supports StreamingConnectionInfo only: The function maps the EthernetConnectionInfo onto a StreamingConnectionInfo and fills the missing parameters e.g. with default streaming parameters if possible. If this is not possible the function has to return null.

member.returns: Valid ConnectionInfo for the device or null if mapping is not possible

member.summary: Function to do final device settings according to the given . Use this function to setup e.g. trigger master and trigger slave, choose certain time stamp settings etc. which is relevant for the given data acquisition mode. Since all devices of a certain device family, that take part in the measurement are also given to this function, there is the possibility to handle certain devices in different ways (e.g. trigger master gets other settings/preparations than the slaves etc.).
member.param: that describes how to start the measurement
Devices of the family that take part in the measurement
member.remarks: Do not use but one of the DataAcquisitionModes returned by the function
